intro: Trianthema hydaspicum, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. The flowers bloom in the early morning, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
